photos.caption: Lobster, abalone, garoupa, scallop, fried chicken well presented on three-tiered plate.
Grand Harvest Combination Platter 大豐收大拼盤

reviews.text: They charged us twice the price of what we ordered. We suspect  this was deliberate fraud as the itemised bill was in Chinese  but the printed invoice was twice the amount.
reviews.title: Be careful to check the bill

reviews.text:
We chose according to what we read over the reviews and we weren't disappointed with the food. The Soon Hock was really good and fresh. The big head fresh water prawns were good too.
The service was excellent and the restaurant was crowded even in the weekdays. 
Worth another visit next time visiting Ipoh.
reviews.title: Good food!!

reviews.text: If you have a party of 10 or more, you must order the Grand Harvest! If you are still hungry after that, there are lots of other delicious dishes to order. The Grand Harvest cost 948 ringgit or about $300 Singapore dollars.
reviews.title: Great food!

reviews.text:
Another great place to have good chinese food. A bit far from Ipoh town but the drive out is worth it. The dishes are old fashion and really yummy. The service is also very good. Again, is hard to find good service nowadays. Local waitresses and waiters who understands what you want is a gem!!

will definitely go back to try out their other dishes!
reviews.title: Great food!

reviews.text: Came on a Tuesday evening and the restaurant wasn’t v busy. The manager did a good job and recommended the dishes. The food was good and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Good food reasonable price

ranking_data.ranking_string: #423 of 799 Places to Eat in Ipoh

reviews.text: eating cheap food=very long time waiting to serve? eating expensive food canf faster serve? service very bad , chief very less,very cold air con,need to change please. THANK YOU .
reviews.title: SERVICE VERY BAD ESPECIALLY WORKER INSIDE

reviews.text: This is one of the better airconditioned restaurants in the area, but for some reason we had not gone there for many years. Deciding to give it a try, we walked in one quiet evening and were the first to be there for dinner. The helpful staff was patient and able to offer some choices, as there was no written menu. We found the cooking to be rather good, and wondered why we had not started going there earlier!
reviews.title: Fu Lim re-visited

reviews.text: We enjoyed meal here with friends. Good choice of dishes and taste good too. A bit out of town but worth coming if you are in the area.
reviews.title: Chinese food place

reviews.text: I am a frequent customer to this restaurant. I can say this is a pretty decent chinese restaurant with very good dishes. Totally recommend the sweet sour pork(古老肉). Thumbs up.
reviews.title: Delicious Chinese Dishes

reviews.text:
My dad is a regular and knows the owner well. And we come to Fu Lim every time I am back. The food is just wonderful and super delicious, from the sweet & sour pork to sliced fish with ginger. I especially love their Foo Yong fried egg dish!

Usually a table of 4-5 people will cost less than RM100.00 and everyone goes home very satisfied. It is a just a lovely place for good food.
reviews.title: Wonderful food and great value

address_obj.address_string: Pt 128667 Jalan Menglembu, Menglembu 31450 Malaysia
Pt 128667 Jalan Menglembu, Menglembu 31450 Malaysia

ranking_data.ranking_string: #1 of 3 Places to Eat in Menglembu

reviews.text: The food are good and above average. Environment is so so but its cleanliness is satisfied. Advised to make appointment before head to the restaurant to prevent full house.
reviews.title: Above Average Food

reviews.text:
This place is huge and very popular. However, cleanliness is the pits. 
The placeis not suitable for a couple as the tables are huge and almost all are full. The food is great but what puts you off is the lack of service etiquette and dirty glasses or cups. The food is good and portions large.
It is kinda an eat and leave place, no relaxed chit chatting, the food arrives very fast
reviews.title: Famous but needs some improvement

reviews.text:
Unfortunately, the standard at this restaurant was very poor, the head waitress had extremely bad mood to us.]

I had booked a day early. When we were brought to our seat by the waitress that night, we felt very angry and surprised. Why?! Let me explain to you !

They arranged us to sit in front of the kitchen. Did they want us to watch the waiters in and out of the kitchen? And the kitchen is not covered by the door! After that, I tried to ask the head waitress if we could change another seat, the waitress was very rude and replied to us very loudly that :"The customer could not choose where to sit in this restaurant" ! 

We complained to the proprietress that told her about the situation we encountered, but she did not solve the problem.

We did not enjoy the process throughout the dinner, The dishes served very slow , my children have been waiting for a long time and are very hungry, they choose to eat plain white rice with some soy sauce while waiting other dished. I think they deliberately did this.

They destroyed my father’s birthday meal. We are very disappointed with everything about them. 

We would never go again to this place for any reason and I don't recommend this restaurant !
reviews.title: [Crowded with bad customer service and dirty water glasses.

reviews.text: I afraid the longevity bun is not well heat up. Only the surface skin is smooth enough, the inner small bun is still hard and not hot enough. Thumb down. Overall the price is standard. We ordered a pot of seafood pot is a small size. It is good and we have 5 people. The portion is quite ok, we are very filling.
reviews.title: Celebration for father birthday

reviews.text:
Still very good.
Be it presentation, taste, quality & this time I did ask for a major change to the menu.
We had 5 differences this time & paid less than RM2,500 per table.
We had 3 tables & every each of them has only one good word (superior) too Full.
Buddha jump over the wall (very good)
Our new order of Suckling Pig on Glutinous Rice (2 thumbs up)
Boston Lobster in superior sauce. (2 thumbs up)
Mango Platter  (thumb)
2 ways fish dish (2 thumbs up)
reviews.title: 3rd visit in a year

ranking_data.ranking_string: #380 of 799 Places to Eat in Ipoh

photos.caption: Noodles fried with duck flesh, part of the beijing duck course
complimentary dessert of very good taufufah, with an extra bowl of ginger sugar syrup
Front: fish paste strips with taufu and beancurd skin, back dish fried fish in sauce
fish braised in claypot....has to be pre-ordered
two dishes on table, with a view of the restaurant

reviews.text:
For chinese new year 2020, a takeaway of the duck, char siew and siew yoke were preordered. The packaging was ok however the portions where shocking for Ipoh standards. Char siew was rm68, siew yoke was rm48, duck was rm68. The portions were only for like 3 or 4 pax. 

Rip off portioning so advisavle to stay away. It was opened for CNY and noticeably less people at the restaurant. 

As for the food quality it was ok and nothing to shout about. Be warned.... Kong hee fatt choy.
reviews.title: Shocking portions

reviews.text: Went for dinner there tonight wif family, 6 adults & a small kid hence we opt for 5pax set menu + a separate ala carte Thai style fried pork knuckle instead of the 10pax set menu which we couldn't really finish anyway. Services were cold from the captains as they pay more attention to those high spending tables. The worst is they didn't even bother to tell you until we asked them to serve our desserts which is included in our set menu, that the dessert is out of stock (finished). They don't even try to replace the dessert with other same value items nor they try to say sorry about it. A bit disappointed with their captains' services & attitude but other staffs are okay.
reviews.title: Captains are a bit pigeon eyes

reviews.text: Went with a group of friends for dinner. Every one agreed that the food was above average yet it was not expensive at all. Atmosphere and service both good.one particular dish I like to recommend is Peking Duck. At 78 ringgit you can't complain. You need to order one day ahead for this. They wanted to serve us ready wrapped which we refused,for it may take the fun part of wrapping your own. All in all a satisfied meal.
reviews.title: A good place for Peking duck

reviews.text: Visited this restaurant several times, the food we ordered so far test great with good standard. The service was OK too. Hope the restaurant maintain the good standard and we will visit again and again.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.text: We went this on 2  Dec .This is the third time I have come to this restaurant for dinner. celebrate my sister birthday with my family. We pre-order set dinner , price reasonable , but the service was very poor, food served very slow. It took a dish to wait for 10-15 min for a dish to be called, No one cares about us !! Food quality was drop,steamed fish over cook !! Very disappointed dining experience!
reviews.title: Disappointed & bad service!!!

ranking_data.ranking_string: #466 of 799 Places to Eat in Ipoh

photos.caption: simple but delicious omelette with preserved radish

reviews.text: Restaurant Mandarin Kitchen was first located along the main road leading to Falim. We found the food good, and so did our friends, especially when the location was suitable for us. However the friendliness of the owner-chef and wife leaves much to be desired, and some of our friends refused to go back. If one can ignore the cool reception, the food is a big attraction, as some of the dishes are imaginative, and different from the usual ones offered elsewhere. The prawns with blueberry sauce was good, as was the ice-cream with pork ribs. They have recently moved away to a back road, out of sight from the main road. But in this new place, they have a double lot, with upstairs, and seem to have attracted a whole lot of customers lining up for their food especially during weekends.
reviews.title: For enjoyment of food

address_obj.address_string: No 17 Jalan Mandarin 1 Taman Mandarin, Ipoh 31650 Malaysia
No 17 Jalan Mandarin 1 Taman Mandarin, Ipoh 31650 Malaysia

reviews.text:
The host is a very nice person. She introduced parts of the house in details when we arrived.
The rooms are spacious and washrooms are with shampoo and body shampoo. All areas of the house are clean.
Perfect for family and friends getaway stay. The location of the house is near to almost all popular food. The host also prepared a list of popular restaurants and must go places for reference.
reviews.title: Happy stay!
